# NSEnumerator

**Class**

An abstract class whose subclasses enumerate collections of objects, such as arrays and dictionaries.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSEnumerator
```

## Overview

All creation methods are defined in the collection classes—such as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArray], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSet], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary]—which provide special [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSEnumerator] objects with which to enumerate their contents. For example, `NSArray` has two methods that return an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSEnumerator] object: [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSet/objectEnumerator()] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArray/reverseObjectEnumerator()]. `NSDictionary` also has two methods that return an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSEnumerator] object: [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/keyEnumerator()] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDictionary/objectEnumerator()]. These methods let you enumerate the contents of a dictionary by key or by value, respectively.

You send [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSEnumerator/nextObject()] repeatedly to a newly created [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSEnumerator] object to have it return the next object in the original collection. When the collection is exhausted, `nil` is returned. You cannot “reset” an enumerator after it has exhausted its collection. To enumerate a collection again, you need a new enumerator.

The enumerator subclasses used by `NSArray`, `NSDictionary`, and `NSSet` retain the collection during enumeration. When the enumeration is exhausted, the collection is released.



## Getting the Enumerated Objects

- **allObjects**: The array of unenumerated objects.
- **nextObject()**: Returns the next object from the collection being enumerated.

## Default Implementations

- **Sequence Implementations**

## Iteration

- **NSFastEnumeration**: A protocol that objects adopt to support fast enumeration.
- **NSFastEnumerationIterator**
- **NSIndexSetIterator**: An iterator suitable for enumerating the elements of an index set.
- **NSEnumerationOptions**: Options for block enumeration operations.
- **NSSortOptions**: Options for block sorting operations.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- FileManager.DirectoryEnumerator

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSFastEnumeration
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sequence
